quotes.quote: They say good things take time, that's why I run slow.
You run funny but you don't run so badly.
The pleasure of jogging and running is rather like that of wearing a fur coat in Texas in August: the true joy comes in being able to take the damn thing off.
If you come to think of it, you never see deer, dogs, and rabbits worrying about their menus, and yet they run much faster than humans.
Even if you fall flat on your surface at least you are moving forward.
Even in high school, you were some kind of fruitcake if you ran, like you were naked in the wind. Nobody else did it; there were no cheerleaders or anything like that,
Running is like mouthwash; if you can feel the burn, it's working.
A Sunny day in winter' is a nice way of describing the seasoned runner. I've heard worse.
When I jog I joggle.
Another patron in the restaurant learned of my run, and he sang me an impromptu song opera-style about how what I was doing was crazy. It caught me off guard, and all I could do was laugh!
I had my personal soundtrack of echoing cows as I ran through the hills. At the time it seemed quite funny, and if nothing else, it kept my spirits up.
Choosing how many days per week to run is like finding a life partner. You just know when it's right.

Before getting finally straightened out, he dealt with his problems in two ways, both a bit extreme. He went on what he calls his divorce diet, and he started running a hundred miles a week. The net result? 'I lost 40 pounds,' he says. '150 if you include my wife.'
Funny dad, you ran six miles; I stayed here eating frozen waffles and lookie here: we both ended up in the same place!'
Long distance running is 90 percent mental and the other half is physical.
Act like a horse. Be dumb. Just run.
No doubt a brain and some shoes are essential for marathon success. Although if it comes down to a choice, pick the shoes. More people finish marathons with no brains than with no shoes.
I used to jog but the ice cubes kept falling out of my glass.
I've always felt that long, slow distance produces long, slow runners.
Run like you stole something.
Jogging is for people who aren't intelligent enough to watch television.
I love running cross country....On a track, I feel like a hamster.
I run so my goals in life will continue to get bigger instead of my belly.
The trouble with jogging is that by the time you realize you're not in shape for it, it's too far to walk back.
I go running when I have to. When the ice cream truck is doing sixty.
Good things come slow - specially in distance running.
My doctor told me that jogging could add years to my life. I think he was right. I feel ten years older already.
